lexUnit.name: sizzle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make a hissing sound in or as if in roasting or frying

sentence.text: The wild pigs on the spit sizzled gently .
Uncover the pan and continue cooking until all the moisture has evaporated ; the pan should also be sizzling again and the dumplings golden brown and crisp underneath .
You 're going to a friend 's for a barbecue on a hot summer 's evening , and you 're walking up the drive and you can smell the barbecue sizzling away .
Breakfast of sausage , egg and chips was sizzling over camp-fires .
Inside was a lighted wick ; as the metal dish warmed up , the nicotine began to sizzle and give off fumes lethal to red spider mite and aphids .
The torsos sizzle in their own fat , swell and explode . "
She did this now and the spit sizzled on the iron .
The omelette sizzled in the cast-iron pan .
A fire was burning in a black grate which had an oven to the side of it ; a large black kettle was sizzling on the hob .
Droplets of coffee sizzled on the hotplate .

Tomorrow this butter will be enriching many a roast chicken , thousands of omelettes and cakes and pastries , filling the kitchens of France with the incomparable scent of butter gently sizzling in a frying pan …
The bacon began to sizzle in the pan .
In the kitchen the meat sizzled in the oven and a big pan of potatoes stood on the hob .
Thick slabs of bacon sizzled on a pan that sat by the fire , and they mopped up the fat with grainy bread , washing it down with spring water .
The spaghetti sizzled in the saucepan , the toast flared beneath the grill .
The pig sizzled on the flames , spitting fat , startling the Daurog for a moment .
They took it in turns to breathe in the smoke , as the substance sizzled with a malicious delight .
When it begins to sizzle , add the garlic cloves and cook until tender and evenly browned .
Only a clock ticked and a saucepan sizzled , now and then , upon the diminutive stove .
